title: Flanders adds over 646 MW of solar in 2024
keywords: Solar deployment;MW (Megawatt);Solar mandate;Distribution system operator;Cumulative capacity;InterSolution;Residential market;Digital meter;Self;consumption;Energy sharing
description: In 2024, Flanders, Belgium's northern region, installed 646.19 MW of solar capacity. While this represents a decrease from the record-breaking 2023, it still exceeds 2022's installation numbers. The region's solar growth is supported by progressive policies including net metering, energy sharing initiatives, and digital meter implementation. The residential market remains strong, with increasing adoption of self-consumption systems.

title: Juwi to build 340 MW of solar in South Africa this year
keywords: Renewable energies;Large;scale private solar projects;Power wheeling;Independent power producers;Clean energy transition;Carbon;intensive economy;Solar;plus;storage;Photovoltaic Industry Association;Energy;intensive sectors
description: Juwi Renewable Energies is making a significant contribution to South Africa's energy transition by developing three large-scale private solar projects totaling 340 MW. These projects will serve energy-intensive sectors including data centers, chemical companies, and mining operations. The development represents a major step in South Africa's shift from its carbon-intensive economy, utilizing power wheeling agreements and independent power producer models.

title: Austria To Offer 'Made In Europe' Bonus For Solar & Storage
keywords: Made in Europe bonus;Small;scale solar;Energy storage;European;made components;EAG framework;Renewable Energy Expansion Act;Climate neutrality;Photovoltaic Strategy;Value;added tax (VAT) exemption
description: Austria is introducing a new incentive program to boost domestic solar manufacturing and deployment. The Ministry of Economic Affairs will offer up to a 20% bonus for small-scale solar and energy storage projects that use European-made components. This initiative, launching on June 23, 2025, is part of Austria's broader strategy to achieve climate neutrality and strengthen the European solar value chain.

title: Low Carbon, ElectroRoute sign four PPAs covering 140 MW of UK solar
keywords: Power Purchase Agreements (PPA);Solar capacity;Balancing PPAs;Energy trading;Market access;Delivery risk;Renewable energy;Energy storage;Bankable solutions
description: UK developer Low Carbon has secured four power purchase agreements (PPAs) with ElectroRoute for 140 MW of solar capacity. These agreements, effective until March 2028, cover four solar farms and represent a significant step in the UK's renewable energy market development. ElectroRoute will manage delivery risk while Low Carbon handles operations and maintenance, demonstrating a new model for solar project financing and operation.

title: Lithuania deploys 870 MW of solar in 2024
keywords: Solar capacity;net metering;subsidies;prosumers;grid connections;hybrid systems;utility;scale;residential solar;energy communities;storage installations
description: Lithuania achieved a significant milestone in 2024 by installing 870 MW of solar capacity, setting a new national record. This growth is driven by comprehensive support policies including subsidies for households and businesses, net metering schemes, and innovative rural solar plant initiatives. The country's success demonstrates the effectiveness of combining financial incentives with community-focused energy solutions.

title: China's battery storage capacity doubles in 2024
keywords: Battery storage stations;GW/GWh capacity;Utility;scale assets;Centraliz
description: China's energy storage sector experienced remarkable growth in 2024, with the commissioning of 515 new battery storage stations adding 37 GW/91 GWh of capacity. This represents a doubling of the country's storage capacity, with a notable shift towards large-scale, centralized storage solutions. The expansion supports China's renewable energy integration and grid stability goals.

title: MENA region hits 24 GW (AC) of total solar capacity
keywords: Solar Outlook Report 2025;Energy storage;Green hydrogen;Grid stability;Solar component manufacturing;Localiz
description: The MENA region's solar market showed strong growth in 2024, with a 25% year-on-year increase in capacity reaching 24 GW (AC). Saudi Arabia, UAE, and Egypt led this expansion, according to MESIA's Solar Outlook Report 2025. The region is increasingly focusing on energy storage, green hydrogen production, and local manufacturing to support its renewable energy transition.

title: German Parliament Amends Energy Policies Ahead Of Federal Election
keywords: Renewable Energy Sources Act (EEG);Energy Industry Act (EnWG);Solar Peak Act;Smart meters;Grid overloads;Digitaliz
description: The German Parliament has made significant amendments to energy policies ahead of the federal election, focusing on the EEG (Renewable Energy Sources Act) and EnWG (Energy Industry Act). These changes aim to modernize Germany's energy infrastructure through increased digitalization, smart meter implementation, and measures to prevent grid overloads, particularly during peak solar generation periods.

title: Queensland Introduces Rigorous Approval Processes For Solar
keywords: Rigorous approval processes;Renewable energy projects;Planning Act;Social impact assessment;Community benefit agreement;Public consultation;Transparency;Local councils;Development application;Renewable energy targets
description: Queensland has implemented new comprehensive approval processes for solar projects, requiring developers to demonstrate clear community benefits and secure agreements with local councils. This policy change ensures renewable energy projects undergo the same rigorous assessment as other major developments, emphasizing social impact assessment, public consultation, and transparency in the development process.

title: Switzerland installs 1.78 GW of PV in 2024
keywords: PV systems;Swissolar;Newly installed capacity;Electricity Act;Energy communities;Virtual power plants;Cumulative installed solar capacity;Annual additions;Temporary uncertainties
description: Switzerland achieved a significant milestone in 2024 by installing 1.78 GW of PV capacity. This growth is supported by the country's progressive Electricity Act, which promotes energy communities and virtual power plants. Despite some temporary market uncertainties, the Swiss solar market continues to show strong growth, contributing to the country's renewable energy transition.

title: Japan's 23rd solar auction concludes with lowest bid of $0.030/kWh
keywords: Utility;scale solar;PV projects;Auction;Procurement exercise;Generating capacity;Power purchase agreement (PPA);Clean energy;Import tariffs;Subsidiz
description: Japan's 23rd solar auction, conducted by the Green Investment Promotion Organization, concluded with a record-low bid of $0.030/kWh. This auction represents a significant milestone in Japan's renewable energy transition, demonstrating the increasing competitiveness of utility-scale solar projects. The results reflect the country's commitment to clean energy development and the effectiveness of its auction-based procurement system.

title: Finland's solar additions fall to around 200 MW in 2024
keywords: Solar deployment;Utility;scale projects;Outside;the;meter installations;Inside;the;meter installations;Cumulative capacity;Large;scale sites;Project profitability;Cross;border solar tender;Grid connection permit;Centraliz
description: Finland's solar market saw approximately 200 MW of new capacity installed in 2024, representing a decrease from previous years. The market is characterized by a mix of utility-scale projects and smaller installations, with factors such as grid connection permits and project profitability influencing development. The country is also exploring cross-border solar tenders to optimize renewable energy deployment.

title: TOYO Begins Production At 2 GW Solar Cell Factory in Ethiopia
keywords: Solar cell factory;Commercial production;Annual production capacity;ADCVD tariffs;Supply chains;Cell manufacturing;Production capacity;External customer demand;Solar module factory;Anti;dumping duties
description: TOYO, a Japanese solar manufacturer, has commenced operations at its new 2 GW solar cell factory in Ethiopia. The facility aims to produce over 80 MW of solar cells by the end of April and plans to reach full capacity of 150-200 MW monthly production by mid-2025. This expansion represents a strategic move to diversify manufacturing locations and address global supply chain challenges.

title: India plans 50 MW floating solar plant at nuclear site
keywords: Floating solar plant;Nuclear power plant;Seawater dyke;Shallow reservoir;Steam condenser;Inlet water;Heated water discharge;Floating solar potential;Megawatt (MW)
description: India's Nuclear Power Corporation (NPCIL) is exploring the development of a 50 MW floating solar plant at the Kudankulam Nuclear Power Plant in Tamil Nadu. The project, to be built on a seawater dyke, represents an innovative approach to utilizing water bodies for solar generation while potentially providing cooling benefits to the nuclear facility.

title: Israel awards 1.5 GW energy storage in tender, pricing from $49.41 to $74.20 per kWh
keywords: High;voltage battery storage;Energy transition;Capacity tariffs;Large;scale energy storage systems;Renewable energy integration;Grid integration;Electricity Authority;Tender;Agorot;kWh
description: Israel has awarded contracts for 1.5 GW of high-voltage battery storage capacity across three regions, marking a significant step in the country's energy transition. The tender, managed by the Israeli Electricity Authority, attracted 11 bidders proposing 29 projects, with capacity tariffs ranging from 2.0 to 3.0 agorot per kW ($0.00564 to $0.00847 per kW). This development will enhance grid stability and renewable energy integration.

title: Axpo, EDF Renewables Hellas sign 102 MW solar PPA in Greece
keywords: Power Purchase Agreement (PPA);Solar power plants;Renewable energy;Energy transition;Decarbonisation;Short;term PPAs;Cumulative solar capacity;Europe;wide expertise;Electricity value chain
description: Swiss energy company Axpo has entered into a Power Purchase Agreement (PPA) with EDF Renewables Hellas for two solar power plants in Greece, totaling 102 MW. This agreement follows Axpo's recent PPAs in Hungary and Croatia, demonstrating the company's expanding presence in the European renewable energy market. The deal contributes to Greece's growing solar capacity and energy transition goals.

title: DAS Solar plans 3 GW solar module factory in France
keywords: Solar module assembly;PV cell manufacturing;n;type tunnel oxide passivated contact (TOPCon) technology;Floating;rooftop;and carport PV applications;End;of;life solar panel reprocessing;Regional industrial hub;Panel and cell capacity
description: Chinese solar manufacturer DAS Solar is making a significant investment in European manufacturing with plans to build a 3 GW solar module assembly factory in Mandeure, France. The company is investing €109 million in the initial project, with plans for further expansion including a 5 GW cell manufacturing plant. This move represents a major step in strengthening Europe's solar manufacturing capacity and supply chain resilience.

title: Chinese PV Industry Brief: Tongwei, GoodWe post 2024 losses
keywords: Solar cells;Module shipments;High;purity silicon;Inverter demand;Photovoltaic silver paste;BIPV glass;Quad;silver coating;Energy;efficient glass;Low;carbon glass products;Internal rate of return
description: Several major Chinese solar companies, including Ginlong Technologies, GoodWe, Flat Glass Group, Jianbang Hi-Tech, and Shanghai Yaopi Engineering Glass, have reported their 2024 financial results. The report provides insights into the performance of different segments of China's solar industry, from module manufacturing to inverter production and specialized glass manufacturing, highlighting the challenges and opportunities in the current market.

title: India Reduces Tariffs on Imported Solar Cells and Modules
keywords: Union Budget 2025;Solar cells;Solar modules;Customs duty;National Manufacturing Mission;Renewable energy;Basic Customs Duty (BCD);Approved List of Models and Manufacturers (ALMM);Cleantech manufacturing;Non;fossil fuel power generation
description: India's Union Budget 2025 includes significant changes to solar import tariffs, reducing duties on imported solar cells and modules. This policy change aims to support the country's National Manufacturing Mission while balancing the need for affordable solar components. The move is expected to impact both domestic manufacturing and the overall cost of solar projects in India.

title: Slovenia adds 298.8 MW of solar in 2024
keywords: Photovoltaic;Net metering;Tariff system;Utility;scale capacity;Solar;hybrid solutions;Community self;consumption;Regulatory changes;Solar standard;Solar energy communities
description: Slovenia installed 298.8 MW of solar capacity in 2024, with installations spread across residential, commercial, and utility-scale sectors. The country's solar market is supported by a comprehensive policy framework including net metering, new tariff systems, and community self-consumption initiatives. While the residential market faces some challenges, the overall growth demonstrates Slovenia's commitment to renewable energy development.

title: Labour-Led Parliament Clears Great British Energy Bill
keywords: Great British Energy;Renewable energy;Energy transition;Public ownership;Energy security;Climate goals;Investment;Green jobs;Energy infrastructure;Policy framework
description: The UK Parliament has passed the Great British Energy Bill, a landmark piece of legislation that establishes a new publicly-owned energy company. This initiative aims to accelerate the country's transition to renewable energy, enhance energy security, and create green jobs. The bill represents a significant step in the UK's efforts to meet its climate goals and modernize its energy infrastructure.

title: Astronergy to build $500 million solar cell factory in Turkey
keywords: Solar cell factory;TOPCon 4.0 solar cell;High;Tech Incentive Program (HIT;30);R&D and innovation center;PV module;Foreign investment;Green energy goals;Technological cooperation;Strategic position
description: Astronergy, a Chinese solar module manufacturer, has announced plans to build a solar cell factory in Turkey. The company is investing at least $500 million in an advanced solar cell production line and R&D center as part of Turkey's High-Tech Incentive Program (HIT-30), with 80% of the output designated for export.

title: €480 Million for European Solar PV Partnership

description: The European Commission has announced a €480 million partnership for European solar PV technology. title: India's NHPC awards 1.2 GW of solar with storage at $0.036/kWh

NHPC will enter into 25-year power purchase agreements with the successful developers.

keywords: Solar cell and module factory;Single;location solar manufacturing facility;Tunnel oxide passivated contact (TOPCon);Mono passivated emitter rear cell (PERC);Supply chain;Community development;Job opportunities;Market distribution

The country's total PV capacity reached 100.8 GW at the end of December 2024.

description: The article reports on Alight's activation of Sweden's largest solar park to date, a 64 MW facility in Hallstavik. It details a power purchase agreement with Axfood, Alight's expansion plans, and recent developments in Sweden's solar energy sector.

title: Panama installs 143.4 MW of new solar in 2024
keywords: PV capacity;National Public Services Authority (ASEP);National Electricity System (SIN);Renewable energy penetration;Self;generation plants;Stand;alone systems;Thermal power;Hydropower;Wind power
description: The article reports on Panama's solar energy capacity growth in 2024. It details the country's total installed capacity, including solar PV, and provides a breakdown of electricity generation by source. The article also mentions Panama's renewable energy target for 2050.

title: Ciel & Terre completes 120 MWp floating solar array with new anchoring tech
keywords: Floating PV solutions;Hydrelio floats;Rock bolt anchoring;Fiber;reinforced plastic (FRP) barge;Spin welding;Thermal expansion;Cumulative capacity;Floating inverter barge;Leak;proof joints;Ultra Mega Solar
description: The article reports on the completion of a 120 MWp floating solar array in Omkareshwar, Madhya Pradesh, India by Ciel & Terre, a France-based company. This project, developed in collaboration with L&T and SJVN Green Energy Ltd., is Ciel & Terre's largest in India and is built on the Omkareshwar Dam reservoir, covering 20% of the water surface.

title: France concludes C&I rooftop PV tender with average price of €0.0982/kWh
keywords: C&I rooftop solar systems;Tender;Procurement exercise;Allocated capacity;Developers;kWh;Undersubscribed;MW
description: The article discusses the results of France's ninth round of tenders for C&I rooftop solar systems for the 2021-26 period. The Ministry of Ecological and Solidarity Transition allocated 220 MW of solar capacity to 54 developers at an average price of €0.0982/kWh, which was less than the originally planned 400 MW allocation.

title: Solex Energy to open 2 GW TOPCon cell plant in 2027
keywords: n;type TOPCon solar cell;Integrated solar cell;module facility;Module production capacity;GW (Gigawatt);Solar manufacturing;TOPCon module;Cumulative module capacity;Cell capacity
description: Gujarat-based Solex is expanding its solar manufacturing capacity with a new 2 GW n-type TOPCon solar cell facility, set to begin operations in early 2027. This development is part of Solex's broader plan to increase its total module output to 4 GW annually by September 2025 and aims to reach a cumulative module capacity of 15 GW and cell capacity of 5 GW by the end of the decade.

title: Almost 9 GW of utility-scale solar under construction in Africa
keywords: Utility;scale solar projects;Battery energy storage systems (BESS);Hybrid utility;scale projects;Grid stability;Bilateral negotiations;Project development time;Solar capacity;Africa Solar Industry Association (AFSIA);Private developers;Solar Outlook 2025 report
description: The article discusses the current state of solar energy development in Africa, based on an update from the Africa Solar Industry Association (AFSIA). It highlights that nearly 9 GW of solar capacity is under development across the continent, with a growing trend towards hybrid projects combining solar and battery energy storage systems.

title: Germany allocates 2.15 GW in latest PV tender, final average price for first time under €0.05/kWh since 2019
keywords: Utility;scale solar;PV capacity;Federal Network Agency (Bundesnetz
description: Germany's Federal Network Agency has allocated 2,150 MW of PV capacity in its latest utility-scale solar tender. The tender was oversubscribed, with 524 project proposals totaling 4.70 GW, and the average price came in at €0.0476/kWh. This allocation slightly exceeded the initially planned capacity.

title: Malaysia introduces rooftop solar aggregation scheme
keywords: Community Renewable Energy Aggregation Mechanism (CREAM);Rooftop solar systems;Local Energy Generators and Aggregators (LEGA);Open grid access;Energy transition;Renewable energy capacity;Corporate Renewable Energy Supply Scheme (CRESS);Large;scale solar program;Cumulative solar capacity
description: Malaysia's Ministry of Energy Transition and Water Transformation (PETRA) has launched the country's first aggregation initiative for rooftop solar systems called the Community Renewable Energy Aggregation Mechanism (CREAM) program. This initiative allows homeowners to lease their rooftop space to third parties for solar system development, with the generated electricity to be sold to local consumers through the national grid.

title: Peru plans to reach 3 GW of PV capacity by 2028
keywords: Solar projects;National Interconnected Electric System (SEIN);Installed PV capacity;Isolated;system projects;Advanced stages of construction;Investment;Megawatts (MW);Gigawatts (GW)
description: Peru's MINEM has announced plans for 14 solar projects totaling 2.5 GW by 2028, all to be connected to the National Interconnected Electric System (SEIN). This significant expansion will increase Peru's solar capacity from the current 528 MW to at least 2.98 GW by 2028, with projects spread across multiple departments and substantial investments in individual projects.
